question: In order to assess the preventive and immunological effects of the newly developed hepatitis A vaccine, 7-year-old susceptible children in a village were immunised with the hepatitis A vaccine. After 3 years of follow-up observation, the results were as follows.<image 1> The main outcome of the study was
options: ['Incidence of hepatitis A', 'Prevalence of hepatitis A', 'Secondary attack rate of hepatitis A', 'Survival rate of hepatitis A']
description:
The image presents data from a study assessing the effectiveness of a newly developed hepatitis A vaccine among 7-year-old susceptible children in a village. The study involved two groups: a vaccination group and a control group, each consisting of 500 individuals. 

- **Vaccination Group**: This group consisted of 500 children who received the hepatitis A vaccine. After a 3-year follow-up period, only 1 case of hepatitis A was observed.
  
- **Control Group**: This group also consisted of 500 children but did not receive the vaccine. Over the same 3-year follow-up period, 10 cases of hepatitis A were recorded.

The table provides the total number of persons in each group (500 for both) and the corresponding number of hepatitis A cases (1 in the vaccination group and 10 in the control group). The primary focus of the study appears to be comparing the occurrence of hepatitis A between vaccinated and unvaccinated children over time.
